title: Decomission of Lucy (UNIX group, perms in svnauth file, website)
description:
Hi Grant,

Lucy was VOTE'd into the Incubator per http://s.apache.org/xU. As part of our Incubator migration and to be good Lucene citizens, I'm adding this issue to track decommissioning Lucy Lucene permissions for UNIX and for SVN. I think this is something you can take care of via your PMC chair hat.

Thanks very much for your help!

Cheers,
Chris

comments.content:
This should really hold off until the Lucy has had a chance to migrate the existing SVN contents to the new incubator home – and then not only should the svn auth be decommissioned, but the directory itself should be removed from svn.

but we're not there yet.
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content: Hoss, agreed. Just wanted this to be a placeholder to track it...
comments.author: Chris A. Mattmann

comments.content:
lucene/lucy was removed in r983077

Grant: you should be able to remove the the svn auth info for lucene/lucy at will.

We should also leave this issue open for dealing with the lucy website redirects once the new incubator website is up and running
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content:
The Lucy incubator website has been up for a couple weeks now.  I see that the
tab on the front page of http://lucene.apache.org/ links to it.  However, if
you visit http://lucene.apache.org/lucy/ directly, you still get the old
subproject site.  Can a redirect please be put in place which points at
http://incubator.apache.org/lucy?
comments.author: Marvin Humphrey

comments.content:
added a redirect in r998383.

I made this redirect all old Lucy URLs to the single new Lucy webpage (since the site is much simpler/flatter now)
comments.author: Hoss Man
